text: 500ml bottle from the eebria sell-off. Pours hazy golden orange with a thin white head. Aromas of orange and passionfruit. Taste is bitter, more orange and tropical fruits. Creamy texture, bitter finish.

Butelka 500ml. Lekko metnawy miedziany kolor. Piana obfita,gesta i utrzymujaca sie dlugo w szkle. Piekny zapach pomaranczy i ananasow dominuje nad lekkim drozdzowym. W smaku festiwal cytrusow: pomarancze,grejfruty pozniej pojawiaja sie ananasy i marakuja.Goryczka od cytrusowego albedo. Lekko oleiste. Swietne piwo .

Bottle shared thanks to Jmgreenuk. Hazy orange with some floaters and a white head. Aroma of citrus hops, massive orange. Flavour is light to moderate sweet and bitter. Light to medium bodied with soft carbonation. [23-08-2016]

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines. Opaque amber visage. Thick, clouded mouth feel. Delicious pineapple and passion fruit taste. Rich, sweet, thick (like me, though not the rich bit). Darjeeling tang too, but mainly the previous 3 things. Great beer.
500ml bottle. Pours slightly hazy orange gold with a medium head. Aroma is pineapple and mango juice. Taste has banana and melon to start. Medium bitter mango finish.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Poured a hazy medium amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is big orange citrus. The flavour is moderate to strong bitter with a crisp, light, refreshing, yeasty, strong orange citrus, woody hop bitter palate and a lingering bitter finish. Medium bodied with average carbonation.

50cl bottle courtesy of and shared with JmGreenUk.
Medium white head. Cloudy amber pour. Lots of orange. Subtle bitterness.
Bottle.Bronze with a small head. Fruity and hoppy in equal measures. Well rounded and easy to drink. Another winner from this excellent brewery.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy amber pour with a bubbly off white head, aroma has some delightful fresh hop action consisting of pine and some melon, taste has pine, some caramel, sweet malts, tangerine, a hint of red fruits, salopian do some decent beers.
Cask-conditioned at the Firefly, Worcester May 2016. Clear amber in colour, with a decent, white, head. Light, citrus, hops, biscuity malts, a touch of citrus fruit and dryish finish. A good bitter.

Draught (Gallows Bird, Espoo)
Lovely fruity citrussy aroma, grapefruit and some tropical fruits. Orange, small sticky loose head - lacing everywhere. Lovely light palate, carbonation low. Gentle sweet pale malts, fruity esters, fruity hops too. Nice grapefruity bitter finish, some slightly nutty twigginess too. Another fine brew from one of my favourite breweries. Classic bitter, KISS, no gimmicks, keeps you wnting more.
500ml, bottle-conditioned. Pours hazy amber. A fruity beer. Quite bitter. Astringent finish. Another good beer from Salopian.
On cask at The Three Fishes in Shrewsbury. Gold in colour, almost no head. Aromas are citrussy, grapefruit lead, continuing onto the palate.
Cask @ The Three Fishes, Shrewsbury. Pours clear gold, thin white head. Aroma is citrus fruit. Taste brings grapefruit, lemon citrus, malts, more grapefruit.

Cask (handpump) @ Fly In The Loaf, 13 Hardman Street, Liverpool, Merseyside, England L1 9AS.Clear medium amber yellow colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, caramel, light nutty, light moderate hoppy, grapefruit. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20120116]

Hand pulled pint into a nonic glass in early Feb 2012: this beer is an autumnal rusty copper colour and comes complete with an off-white head of creamy bubbles. 

The nose is initially of malts, bready and baked biscuits; some hop fruitiness arrives as the beer warms in the glass. 

The taste carries on where the smells left off; malts in the foreground and the hops bitterness arriving later to give the beer a nice balanced feel. 

Yet another easy to drink beer from one of my local breweries; most enjoyable.
Cask by handpump at Bow Bar, Edinburgh (2 Feb 12) - fruity / floral aroma, small white head, well hopped floral / citrus with prolonged sour aftertaste
On cask at the Bow. Pours a golden amber colour with a thin beige head. Aroma is nice and hoppy with pine, chocolate and coffee. Similar flavours with a dry finish. Nice.
cask at the bow ... copper thin white head ... soft sweet  lemon toffee nose ... creamy malts ... sweet toffee .. light  easy ... creamy malts

Cask conditioned	Handpump	Market Porter	London.  An amber brown coloured beer with a whitish head and lacing.  Good fruity hops and bready sweet malts.  Tastes a little thin though.  A good bittersweet balance and decent resiny hops in the mouth but its all just a bit lacking, especially by Salopians standards.

Cask conditioned at Far from the Madding Crowd, Oxford. Reddish amber (Sienna!!) with white head. Rich and full beer, there is a deep earthiness in the malt, granary loaf recently baked, then autumnal fruits, blackberry with a hint of elder on the nose. The hops give it a citric, bitter edginess. A bonus for my 6,000th rating, really very decent indeed.

Gravity cask at the Old Fountain Beer Festival. Pours clear, rich gold with a filmy head. Lightly dank, weed and grass nose, with some honey malts. Pretty sweet, with more honey and light caramel, then modest earth and citrus bitterness. Light nodied with fine carbonation. Sweet, fruity finish with mild bread, light dryness and some citric hops. Good stuff.
